intro: Tetradymia squamata, commonly known as the squamate tetradymia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, mat-forming growth habit. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Tetradymia squamata is often found in open areas such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
